How do you handle the value of a ListPreference with dynamically allocated arrays if the user never entered the settings? I am loading the entries and values of that pref from a database and then setting the default and selected values, all of this happens in the onCreate of my settings activity. If the user though never enters that then a `prefs.getString(listPrefKey, null)` will return null. Would you do something like `prefs.getString(listPrefKey, db.getFirstRow())` or would you force edit the prefs at first launch?
if I understood you correctly, I’d force edit them to default
I guess you would do that, so that you do 1 database lookup instead of multiple

god damn, I have a small viewpager inside a scroll view.
 I want the scroll up events to be passed to the scroll view, and horizontal scrolls to be passed to scrollview’s children.  so I tried to do override the intercept method and return true if scroll is Y,  false if scroll is X. 

problem 1. ACTION_MOVE case is never handled, when scrolling, only ACTION_DOWN

problem 2. Scrolling X on the viewpager works, scrolling Y on the viewpager throws a "Invalid pointerId=-1 in onTouchEvent” in the log :confused:
anyone got a clue?
<@U0548MM6B|bluecup> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/bluecup/F0C9U4X0D/the_intercept_method.txt|the intercept method>

file.title: the intercept method
file.preview_highlight:
@Override


    public boolean onInterceptTouchEvent(MotionEvent event) {




            switch (event.getAction()) {
